item.title: Meta-Generalized-Gradient Approximation made Magnetic
item.description: arXiv:2409.15201v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: The Jacob's ladder of density functional theory (DFT) proposes the compelling view that by extending the form of successful approximations -- being guided by exact conditions and selected (least empirical) norms -- upper rungs will do better than the lower, thus allowing to balance accuracy and computational effort. Meta-generalized-gradient-approximations (MGGA) belong to the last rung of the semi-local approximations before hybridization with non-local wave function theories. The performance of MGGAs on {\em non} magnetic systems greatly improves upon that of GGAs from the lower rung. Instead, failures of MGGAs on magnetic materials are daunting and make GGAs more reliable for magnetism. This raises the question as to whether consistent improvements can be achieved for magnetism along the lines of the Jacob's ladder. Here, we present a solution from first principles: departing from the standard approach (i.e. collinear spin-DFT), we exploit the U(1)$\times$SU(2) gauge symmetry of the exact functional of spin-current-DFT to access an extended set of building blocks for approximations. Crucially, this allows us to treat broken symmetry ferromagnetic and antiferromagnetic states. For these states, we derive a collinear MGGA that performs well for prototypical magnets and make it available in an implementation in the \textsc{Crystal} electronic structure package.
item.dc:creator: Jacques K. Desmarais, Alessandro Erba, Giovanni Vignale, Stefano Pittalis
